Key Arguments: The proposal is seen as a contradiction to democracy and an erosion of rights.
The exemption of the government from the legislation is viewed as totalitarian and dictatorial.
The bill is compared to historical instances of suppression, specifically referencing Nazi-ism.
The legislation is perceived as regressive, treating citizens as if they are incapable of discerning truth.
Notable Quotes: The proposal to censor democracy is a contradiction in terms.
This proposed bill reeks of nazi-ism.
This bill is a shameful proposal which regresses Australians to the dark ages and treats its citizens like errant infants.
